update.description:
I was mostly curious about whether there were classes in gazebo math which have been completely substituted already. That happened to be the case for the splines, but I haven't checked whether there are other classes in the same situation.

I added `-Wno-deprecated-declarations` to suppress deprecation warnings within the math library.

Feel free to decline this pull request if it is not the way we were planning on deprecating gazebo math.

[homebrew](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI any jobs/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/449) has no deprecation warnings

[trusty gpu](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/429/) has no deprecation warnings
update.title: Deprecate gazebo::math::Spline and gazebo::math::RotationSpline

content.raw:
also, I think it maintains previous behavior, since `CommnTypes.hh` forward declares that class

* #!/osrf/gazebo/src/17b2f08327b287ad319132729d19dffef097cb4e/gazebo/common/CommonTypes.hh?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#CommonTypes.hh-97
content.html:

content.raw:
I thought of changing some of them to forward declarations, but it seemed that I was getting out of the scope of the pull request. And considering we're looking into using an automated tool like [include-what-you-use](http://include-what-you-use.org/) to do this kind of checking, I thought it wasn't a good use of time to look it up myself. 

But! I can still change this one, so done: f09bad6
content.html:

But! I can still change this one, so done: f09bad6

content.raw:
Right, but I'd rather not make the link to common.


`gazebo/util/system.hh` looks fine.
content.html:
Right, but I'd rather not make the link to common.

gazebo/util/system.hh looks fine.

content.raw:
We are just using a macro, not any symbols, so we could probably get away with it.

Would it make more sense to add the macro to `gazebo/util/system.hh`?
content.html:
We are just using a macro, not any symbols, so we could probably get away with it.

Would it make more sense to add the macro to gazebo/util/system.hh?

content.raw: This technically places a dependency on `common`, which would create a cyclic dependency. Can you create a new deprecation macro for the math library (`GAZEBO_MATH_DEPRECATED`)?
content.html: This technically places a dependency on common, which would create a cyclic dependency. Can you create a new deprecation macro for the math library (GAZEBO_MATH_DEPRECATED)?

content.raw: Oh awesome, thanks! I was trying to do something like that! Let me give it a try.
content.html: Oh awesome, thanks! I was trying to do something like that! Let me give it a try.

content.raw:
It's not only the tests, but the classes themselves use their own functions, triggering warnings.

Do you know how I could set the flags for a specific set of files? If you don't know it straight away, I can look it up too. Thanks!
content.html:
It's not only the tests, but the classes themselves use their own functions, triggering warnings.

Do you know how I could set the flags for a specific set of files? If you don't know it straight away, I can look it up too. Thanks!

content.raw: I'd prefer to target this warning suppression more narrowly, so that it affects only the tests that are using the deprecated code.
content.html: I'd prefer to target this warning suppression more narrowly, so that it affects only the tests that are using the deprecated code.
